sub_topic: Analyzing the thermodynamics of metabolic pathways.
message_1: Calculate the standard free energy change of the reaction ATP + H2O → ADP + Pi, given that the standard free energy changes of hydrolysis of ATP and ADP are -30.5 kJ/mol and -30.0 kJ/mol, respectively. Also, assume that the standard free energy change of Pi is negligible.
message_2:
To calculate the standard free energy change (ΔG°) of the reaction ATP + H2O → ADP + Pi, we can use the following equation:

ΔG°(reaction) = ΔG°(products) - ΔG°(reactants)

Given that the standard free energy changes of hydrolysis of ATP and ADP are -30.5 kJ/mol and -30.0 kJ/mol, respectively, and the standard free energy change of Pi is negligible, we can plug these values into the equation:

ΔG°(reaction) = (-30.0 kJ/mol) - (-30.5 kJ/mol)

ΔG°(reaction) = 0.5 kJ/mol

So, the standard free energy change of the reaction ATP + H2O → ADP + Pi is 0.5 kJ/mol.
